attributes.comment:
Intermountain Healthcare, as a major employer of healthcare providers, wholeheartedly supports the proposal to create an efficient provider directory service hub for the nation. Like other shared utilities for the public good, we believe operational efficiencies will flow from a registry hub as the trusted source of truth for identifying, disambiguating, locating, validating affiliation, and establishing routing preferences and conditional logic associated with provider lookup. We believe fragmented provider directories confound healthcare reform efforts to improve patient access to timely and equitable healthcare. The lack of a single source of truth across organizations has led to proliferation of specialized directories—several dozen internal provider directories with a specific focus and expensive maintenance costs for synchronization. The high costs described in the RFI are consistent with our experience and difficult to contain when fragmented across diverse business divisions. A single source of truth would establish a path for directory rationalization.

Intermountain submits a detailed response with use cases and questions in support of the initiative to create a National Directory the attached letter.
